author: Jennifer Crothers
title: The Kardashians make hundreds of thousands of dollars for sponsored social media posts
text:
Showbiz The Kardashians make hundreds of thousands of dollars for sponsored social media posts Kim, Khloe and Kourtney are rumoured to be making '25 per cent' of their income from all those paid-for posts Share Kim, Kourtney and Khloe Kardashian make so much dollar from social media (Photo: Instagram) Share Get   
The Kardashians are raking in hundreds of thousands of dollars through Instagram - thanks to sponsored posts. 
Kim, Khloe and Kourtney can earn a six figure sum for each sponsored post they make from their social media accounts, according to Us Weekly . 
Michael Heller, CEO of Talent Resources and who organises many of the sisters' deals, has admitted, "Sponsored posts are about 25 per cent of their income!" 
Kim is reported to earn the most seeing as she has the most followers of the three, with 95 million people checking in on her Instagram. Kim and her vitamins, which she loves (Photo: kimkardashian/Instagram) Khloe looks this good thanks to her Flat Tummy Tea, allegedly... (Photo: khloekardashian/Instagram) Kourtney can't live without her Manuka Doctor oil (Photo: kourtneykardash/Instagram) Kim pretending to chop a tomato unconvincingly for delivery service Chefd (Photo: kimkardashian/Instagram) 
As such, Heller claims she can command $500,000 [£404,604] per campaign, while Kourtney and Khloe, with fewer followers can still make $250,000 [£202,302]. 
Just for pretty much holding an item or writing something nice about it, In the past the Kardashians have promoted protein supplements, light-up phone cases, cosmetics and weight loss tea. 
That said, they won't endorse any old tat. Kim loves her LuMee phone case and would love you to buy one too (Photo: kimkardashian/Instagram) Khloe and her subtle Protein World sippy cup (Photo: khloekardashian/Instagram) Kourtney and her oil again, racking up those $$$ (Photo: kourtneykardash/Instagram) Khloe just really loves protein okay? (Photo: khloekardashian/Instagram) 
"They only endorse what aligns with their lifestyle - they turn a lot down," adds Heller. 
He adds that Kim only promotes brands she has a stake in, including her Kimoji range and LuMee light-up phone covers. And she namechecks Kayne's Yeezy range for adidas, because you'd want to support your spouse, really. 
Last year, Kourtney's ex Scott Disick got rumbled by one of his sponsored posts when he simply cut and pasted an email to an Instagram post for Bootea, which read, "Here you go, at 4pm est, write the below. Caption: Keeping up with the summer workout routine with my morning@booteauk protein shake!" 
Whoops.
